input_spec.title: A Phase II, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of ACM-1234 in Patients with Moderate to Severe Chronic Disease X
input_spec.indication: Moderate to Severe Chronic Disease X

key_endpoints.name: Change from baseline in Disease Activity Score (DAS) at Week 24
key_endpoints.description: Mean change in DAS score from baseline to Week 24

key_endpoints.name: Proportion of patients achieving clinical remission at Week 24
key_endpoints.description: Percentage of patients with DAS < 2.6 at Week 24

key_endpoints.name: Change in quality of life scores
key_endpoints.description: Change in SF-36 scores from baseline

inclusion_criteria: Male or female patients aged 18-75 years
Confirmed diagnosis of Chronic Disease X for at least 6 months
Disease Activity Score (DAS) â‰¥ 3.2 at screening
Inadequate response to at least one conventional therapy
Stable concomitant medications for at least 4 weeks prior to screening
Willing and able to provide written informed consent
exclusion_criteria: Previous treatment with ACM-1234 or similar investigational products
History of severe allergic or anaphylactic reactions
Active malignancy within the past 5 years (except basal cell carcinoma)
Major surgery within 8 weeks prior to screening
Active infection requiring systemic antimicrobial therapy
input_spec.background: Chronic Disease X is a progressive inflammatory condition affecting millions of patients worldwide. Current therapeutic options provide inadequate disease control in a significant proportion of patients. ACM-1234 is a novel small molecule with a unique mechanism of action targeting key inflammatory pathways. Preclinical studies and Phase 1 data have demonstrated promising efficacy and a favorable safety profile. This Phase 2 study aims to establish proof-of-concept for ACM-1234 in patients with moderate to severe Chronic Disease X.

protocol_structured.title: A Phase II, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of ACM-1234 in Patients with Moderate to Severe Chronic Disease X
protocol_structured.indication: Moderate to Severe Chronic Disease X
protocol_structured.study_design: This Phase 2, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel-group study aims to evaluate the efficacy and safety of ACM-1234 in patients with Moderate to Severe Chronic Disease X. A total of 120 participants will be randomized equally into three treatment arms: ACM-1234 100mg once daily, ACM-1234 200mg once daily, or placebo once daily, for a duration of 24 weeks. The primary efficacy endpoint will be the change from baseline in the Disease X Severity Index (DXSI), a validated composite score specific to Moderate to Severe Chronic Disease X, which includes parameters such as symptom frequency, functional impact, and biomarker levels associated with Disease X pathophysiology. Secondary endpoints include assessment of quality of life improvements using the Chronic Disease X Quality of Life Questionnaire (CDXQoL) and reduction in the use of rescue medication. Regular monitoring of potential adverse events, particularly those associated with Disease X flare-ups, will be conducted via bi-weekly clinical evaluations and patient diaries.

objectives.primary: To evaluate the efficacy of ACM-1234 in improving clinical outcomes in patients with moderate to severe Chronic Disease X over a 12-week treatment period.
objectives.secondary: To assess the safety and tolerability of ACM-1234 in patients with moderate to severe Chronic Disease X; To evaluate changes in quality of life as measured by the Chronic Disease X Quality of Life Questionnaire; To determine the pharmacokinetics of ACM-1234 in the study population.

endpoints.name: Change from baseline in Disease Activity Score (DAS) at Week 24
endpoints.description: The primary endpoint is the change from baseline in the Disease Activity Score (DAS) at Week 24, which will be assessed using the standardized DAS measurement tool to quantify disease activity in patients with moderate to severe Chronic Disease X. This endpoint is clinically relevant as it evaluates the efficacy of the intervention in reducing disease activity over a 24-week period, providing insights into the potential therapeutic benefits for patients.

endpoints.name: Proportion of patients achieving clinical remission at Week 24
endpoints.description: The secondary endpoint is the proportion of patients achieving clinical remission of Moderate to Severe Chronic Disease X at Week 24, assessed through a validated disease-specific scoring system that defines clinical remission as a score below a predetermined threshold, indicating significant disease improvement and reduced symptom burden, which is clinically relevant for enhancing patient quality of life.

endpoints.name: Incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events
endpoints.description: The incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events will be measured by recording and categorizing all adverse events that arise following the initiation of the study drug in participants with moderate to severe Chronic Disease X, as assessed by clinical evaluations and patient self-reports throughout the study duration. This endpoint is clinically relevant as it provides critical safety information, enabling the assessment of the risk-benefit profile of the treatment in this patient population.

endpoints.name: Change in quality of life scores
endpoints.description: Change in quality of life scores will be measured using the validated Disease X Quality of Life Questionnaire at baseline, Week 12, and Week 24 to assess the potential impact of the intervention on patients' overall well-being and daily functioning, providing insights into the broader benefits of treatment beyond clinical symptoms.

inclusion_criteria: Adults aged 18-65 years at the time of consent.
Confirmed diagnosis of Moderate to Severe Chronic Disease X as per the criteria established by the latest guidelines.
Patients must have a disease severity score of ≥50 on the Disease X Assessment Scale (DXAS) at screening.
Stable disease treatment regimen for at least 12 weeks prior to randomization, with no changes anticipated during the trial.
Ability to provide written informed consent and comply with study procedures.
Body Mass Index (BMI) between 18.5 and 35 kg/m² at screening.
Female participants of childbearing potential must have a negative pregnancy test at screening and agree to use an effective method of contraception throughout the study.
Participants must have a stable renal function, defined as an estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) of ≥60 mL/min/1.73 m² at screening.
Participants must have liver function tests (AST, ALT, and bilirubin) within 1.5 times the upper limit of normal at screening.
exclusion_criteria: Current participation in another clinical trial or investigational drug study within the last 30 days.
History of allergic reactions to the investigational drug or its components.
Presence of any severe or uncontrolled medical condition that could interfere with study participation or study outcomes.
Pregnancy or breastfeeding during the study period.
Known history of substance abuse or dependency within the past 12 months.
Use of immunosuppressive therapy within the last 6 months, except for corticosteroids at physiologic doses.
Active infection requiring systemic treatment within the past 14 days.
Diagnosis of any other chronic disease that could interfere with the assessment of the study drug's safety or efficacy.

assessments.name: Vital Signs
assessments.description: Measurement of blood pressure, heart rate, respiratory rate, and temperature

assessments.name: Disease Activity Score
assessments.description: Assessment of disease activity using a standardized scoring system specific to Chronic Disease X

assessments.name: Quality of Life Questionnaire
assessments.description: Patient-reported outcomes measuring quality of life related to Chronic Disease X

assessments.name: Functional Capacity Test
assessments.description: Assessment of physical function and capacity related to Chronic Disease X

sections.title: Synopsis
sections.content:
Study Synopsis

Title: A Phase II, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of ACM-1234 in Patients with Moderate to Severe Chronic Disease X
Sponsor: Acme Pharmaceutical Inc.
Phase: Phase 2
Indication: Moderate to Severe Chronic Disease X

Study Design: This is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel-group study evaluating Moderate to Severe Chronic Disease X.
Sample Size: Approximately 120 participants will be enrolled.
Study Duration: 24 weeks.

sections.title: Study Objectives
sections.content:
Primary Objective:
To evaluate the efficacy of ACM-1234 in improving clinical outcomes in patients with moderate to severe Chronic Disease X over a 12-week treatment period.

Secondary Objectives:
To assess the safety and tolerability of ACM-1234 in patients with moderate to severe Chronic Disease X; To evaluate changes in quality of life as measured by the Chronic Disease X Quality of Life Questionnaire; To determine the pharmacokinetics of ACM-1234 in the study population.

protocol_text:
<!-- RAG Context: Found 2 similar protocol(s) -->
CLINICAL TRIAL PROTOCOL

A Phase II, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of ACM-1234 in Patients with Moderate to Severe Chronic Disease X

Protocol Version: 1.0
Sponsor: Acme Pharmaceutical Inc.
Date: 2025-11-12


REFERENCE CONTEXT FROM SIMILAR PROTOCOLS:


Similar Protocol 1 (Similarity: 23.2%):
- Phase: Phase 2
- Indication: Rheumatoid Arthritis
- Design: randomized parallel trial
- Sample Size: 100
- Duration: 52 weeks

Similar Protocol 2 (Similarity: 19.9%):
- Phase: Phase 2
- Indication: Psoriasis
- Design: randomized parallel trial
- Sample Size: 100
- Duration: 52 weeks

============================================================



Study Synopsis

Title: A Phase II, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of ACM-1234 in Patients with Moderate to Severe Chronic Disease X
Sponsor: Acme Pharmaceutical Inc.
Phase: Phase 2
Indication: Moderate to Severe Chronic Disease X

Study Design: This is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel-group study evaluating Moderate to Severe Chronic Disease X.
Sample Size: Approximately 120 participants will be enrolled.
Study Duration: 24 weeks.

Chronic Disease X is a progressive inflammatory condition affecting millions of patients worldwide. Current therapeutic options provide inadequate disease control in a significant proportion of patients. ACM-1234 is a novel small molecule with a unique mechanism of action targeting key inflammatory pathways. Preclinical studies and Phase 1 data have demonstrated promising efficacy and a favorable safety profile. This Phase 2 study aims to establish proof-of-concept for ACM-1234 in patients with moderate to severe Chronic Disease X.

Study Objectives and Endpoints


Primary Objective:
To evaluate the efficacy of the study intervention in patients with Moderate to Severe Chronic Disease X.


Endpoints:
- PRIMARY: Change from baseline in Disease Activity Score (DAS) at Week 24
- SECONDARY: Proportion of patients achieving clinical remission at Week 24
- SECONDARY: Incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events
- EXPLORATORY: Change in quality of life scores


Study Design

This is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel-group study.

Treatment Arms:
  1. ACM-1234 100mg once daily
  2. ACM-1234 200mg once daily
  3. Placebo once daily


Study Population

Target enrollment: 120 participants
Age range: 18-75

Inclusion Criteria:
  1. Male or female patients aged 18-75 years
  2. Confirmed diagnosis of Chronic Disease X for at least 6 months
  3. Disease Activity Score (DAS) â‰¥ 3.2 at screening
  4. Inadequate response to at least one conventional therapy
  5. Stable concomitant medications for at least 4 weeks prior to screening
  6. Willing and able to provide written informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:
  1. Previous treatment with ACM-1234 or similar investigational products
  2. Active or latent tuberculosis
  3. History of severe allergic or anaphylactic reactions
  4. Significant hepatic impairment (ALT/AST > 3x ULN)
  5. Significant renal impairment (eGFR < 30 mL/min/1.73mÂ²)
  6. Active malignancy within the past 5 years (except basal cell carcinoma)
  7. Pregnancy or breastfeeding
  8. Major surgery within 8 weeks prior to screening
  9. Active infection requiring systemic antimicrobial therapy


Study Duration and Schedule

Total study duration: 24 weeks per participant


Statistical Considerations

Sample Size: 120 participants
Statistical analysis will be performed on the intent-to-treat (ITT) population.


Safety Monitoring

Adverse events will be monitored throughout the study and graded according to CTCAE v5.0.
A Data Safety Monitoring Board (DSMB) will review safety data periodically.

forms.form_description: Measurement of blood pressure, heart rate, respiratory rate, and temperature
Assessment of disease activity using a standardized scoring system specific to Chronic Disease X
Patient-reported outcomes measuring quality of life related to Chronic Disease X
Assessment of physical function and capacity related to Chronic Disease X
